newsitem.title: PERU: Lima stocks end off on profit-taking, caution.
newsitem.headline: Lima stocks end off on profit-taking, caution.

text.p: Peruvian shares slipped Wednesday on profit-taking and caution ahead of a possible hike in U.S. interest rates, brokers said.
They predicted the market would stay sluggish in coming days.

"People do not want to enter the market because, while locals are concerned about obtaining liquidity to pay their monthly taxes, foreigners are waiting for a decision on U.S. interest rates," said Pablo Navarro of Fortuna brokerage.
The Lima Stock Exchange's General Index fell 0.86 percent to 1,647.88 points, while the blue-chip Selective Index was off 0.98 percent to close at 2,372.29 points.
Turnover reached 44.3 million soles ($16.8 million) on 1,544 trades as 42 stocks fell, 29 were flat and 20 gained.
Among losers, benchmark Telefonica del Peru B shares fell 1.68 percent to 5.87 soles, while brewery Backus y Johnston was down 1.2 percent to 2.47 soles.
Another leading brewery, Cerveceria del Sur, slipped 0.79 percent to 1.29 soles.
